results.title: Azumi
results.creator_credit: Ryuhei Kitamura, Mataichiro Yamamoto, Toshiyaki Nakazawa, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Sedic International Inc
results.brief_description: Orphaned as a young girl, Azumi is brought up by a masterly warrior to be a highly skilled, trained assassin. One of a band of children brought up in this manner, as adults the crew are sent off to eliminate corrupt warlords who are preventing peace in the land. In battle Azumi and her group encounter an array of fierce and exotic enemies whilst contending with their internal conflicts. Based on the Manga comic, “Azumi” is great fun with its colourful villains and incessant action sequences; although at times quite cheesy, the over-the-top nature of the director’s aesthetic combines well with his flair for outrageous gore and mordant humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ryuhei Kitamura, Mataichiro Yamamoto, Toshiyaki Nakazawa, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Sedic International Inc

results.title: Kaante
results.creator_credit: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel
results.brief_description: This Bollywood remake of “Reservoir dogs” (Tarantino, 1992) is a lot of fun to watch with its musical numbers and an inventive reworking of the central narrative about a gang of criminals who are infiltrated by an undercover cop. After pulling off a daring bank robbery, and lucky escape from the law, the band retreat to sniff out the nark among them. Featuring sprightly performances by Amitabh Bachchan, Sanjay Dutt, Suniel Shetty, Mahesh Manjrekar, Lucky Ali and Kumar Gaurav, the narrative also addresses ethnic stereotyping as the crew lament their treatment at the hands of the Los Angeles Police Department.

results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Park Chan-Wook, Lee Eun, Myung Film, KTB Network and CJ Entertainment
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.

results.title: Phenomena
results.brief_description: Creepy thriller from horror maestro Dario Argento features a strong performance from a very young Jennifer Connelly as an imperilled schoolgirl (also named Jennifer) who undergoes a series of frightening encounters whilst boarding at a Swiss finishing school. After experiencing nightmares that provide insight into a serial killer’s movements, Jennifer’s talent for communicating with insects links her to bug specialist Dr McGregor, with whom she aims to unmask the murderer. Engaging in the tropes of the genre - and using his trademark gore and gross-out aesthetics - Argento provides an array of thrills, scares and narrative twists all backed by a rock soundtrack. Uncut, uncensored widescreen edition. Also known as “Creepers” (US title).

results.creator_credit: Steve Oedekerk, Michael S. Bregman, Don Jinks, Martin Bregman and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This comedy and buddy movie stars Tim Robbins and Martin Lawrence as an unlikely duo who find themsleves in the Arizona desert questioning their life choices.

results.title: Terminal velocity
results.creator_credit: Deran Sarafian, Tom Engelman, Scott Kroopf, Buena Vista and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: All is not what it seems in this action thriller starring Charlie Sheen as the hard-playing reckless skydiving teacher, Ditch Brodie, who finds himself asking questions when his beautiful new student Chris Morrow (Nastassja Kinski) mysteriously meets with a tragic accident on her first jump. Suspense and intrigue follow as Brodie accused of manslaughter is caught up in international espionage involving the Russian mafia. Cast includes James Gandolfini, Chris McDonald.

results.title: The Book of life
results.creator_credit: Hal Hartley, Matt Myers, Thierry Cagianut, Arte, La Sept and Haut et Court
results.brief_description: In the late 1990s a French production company invited several directors to make a short feature about the last day of the millennium; Hal Hartley (the only American to be asked) created a film about Jesus Christ descending to earth to unleash a series of plagues that will end humanity. He is accompanied on this journey by Mary Magdalene (played by English rock icon PJ Harvey) and is forced to face the devil (Thomas Jay Ryan) who has also arrived in New York seeking a showdown with his nemesis. As Jesus retrieves the book (which, in a clever update, is a notebook computer) the devil sits in a bar discussing the merits of humanity with a barmaid and a compulsive gambler. Hartley utilises an array of video and digital techniques, blurring the visuals, speeding them up, slowing them down which creates an effective sense of disorientation and doom. Hartley mainstay Martin Donovan is typically diffident in the role of Jesus.

results.title: Don's Party [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams and Art House Productions
results.brief_description: Bruce Beresford’s classic Australian comedy exposes Australian social mores in the suburbs. Don and Kath have invited a group of friends to celebrate what they believe will be a Labor Party victory on Election night. The night begins happily enough until the guests receive the news that Labor is losing. Old enmities erupt as hostilities break out amongst the guests as the party disintegrates into an alcoholic disaster. Cast includes Ray Barrett, Graham Kennedy, John Hargreaves, Graeme Blundell, Jeanie Drynan and Clare Binney. DVD special two-disc collectors’ edition containing a ‘must see’ interview-style documentary (over two hours long), researched, edited and directed by Mark Hartley. Feature only also available on VHS [307072].

results.title: Nowhere in Africa = Nirgendwo in Afrika
results.creator_credit: Caroline Link, Peter Herrmann, MC One Productions, Bavaria Film and Constantin Film
results.brief_description: As the title suggests, a Jewish family migrate from WWII Germany to Kenya in Africa and find themselves displaced persons and “Nowhere in Africa”. The father Walter, previously a lawyer in Germany, goes on ahead to establish himself and then sends for his socialite wife Jettel and young daughter Regina to come as soon as possible. Struggling with temporary internment by the British and being sacked as farm manager, the family are soon re-established on a new farm and try to cope with being land mangers. The family are bound together, and to the place they now live, through their African cook, Owuor (Sidede Onyulo), who has a special bond with Regina. Letters from home confirm their worst fears as the family members they left behind are sent to live in ghettos and to ‘work camps’. After the war, the family, now established in Africa, struggle with the idea of returning to Germany. A heartfelt and personal family drama located in an imposing landscape and set to a moving musical score. Nominated for an Academy Award in 2002 for Best Foreign Language Film and winner of five German Film Awards. Based on an autobiographical novel by Stefanie Sweig. Cast includes: Juliane Kohler, Merab Ninidze, Matthias Habich, Lea Kurka, Karoline Eckertz.

results.title: Red Beard = Akahige
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The last collaboration between actor Toshiro Mifune and Kurosawa, is a moral tale about a young and arrogant medical graduate - charged by his modern training and ambition - who is devastated to be assigned to an impoverished local clinic. The young doctor’s mentor, Red Beard, aims to show the young gun that there is more to life than prestige and power and more to healing than medicine. Set in 1820, this is a poignant and compassionate work; a humanistic narrative that follows the character’s arc from supercilious to empathetic whilst presenting a myriad of stories about the villagers and their struggles.
